byline.original: By JACK HEALY and NIKOLE HANNAH-JONES

abstract: Interviews across country show many Americans feel nation is increasingly mired in violence and is splitting along racial and ideological lines; mood deepens following police shootings of two black men, Philando Castile and Alton B Sterling, and fatal killing of five police officers in Dallas by black sniper.
lead_paragraph: People in interviews across the United States said the nation increasingly felt mired in bloodshed and blame, and was fracturing along racial and ideological lines.

headline.main: A Struggle for Common Ground, Amid Fears of a National Fracture
headline.print_headline: Seeking Unity, Nation Debates Racial Chasm

snippet: People in interviews across the United States said the nation increasingly felt mired in bloodshed and blame, and was fracturing along racial and ideological lines....

keywords.value: Dallas, Tex, Shooting of Police Officers (2016)
